value.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI
value.excerpt: Welcome to my new series – “Wednesday with DAX”. This is the first video of this series. The first episode covers all Date and Time functions used in Power BI In this video, we will talk about Date and Time functions in Power BI. We will discuss about most useful date and time functions in Power BI.

value.title: Combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX. Just a little bit of DAX! This can be useful when you want to use a single report tooltip for multiple Power BI visuals.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Trace Excel Power Pivot using DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is an awesome tool! You can even use it to trace Power Pivot within Excel. Patrick shows you how!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? We have training courses available to help you with your journey.

value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how you can trace your DAX queries when trying to troubleshoot or optimize Power BI reports and datasets. There are a few options and Adam walks you through them.  DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/  SQL Server Management Studio: https://docs.microsoft.com/sql/ssms/download-sql-server-management-studio-ssms?view=sql-server-ver15

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: You thought DAX? Alex shows you Dynamic M-M-Magic!
value.excerpt: We thought that DAX was the thing in Power BI. Alex proves the M-M-Magic is really with Power Query! If you wanted to be blown away but what Power Query can do, this is the video for you!  Connect with Alex: https://twitter.com/notaboutthecell https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexmpowers/  Power Query folding

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

However, sometimes, you just want this to be in DAX way, so here in this blog and video, I explained how to create

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. As a business, you would like to know how many new customers you have in each month, how many returning,  and how many lost customers. Knowing these, would help you to focus on the growth plan,

value.title: DAX Measure in the Axis of the Power BI Report
value.excerpt: If you even need to show your DAX measures in a chart without a dimension to slice and dice it, you won’t get a great experience in the visual. In this video, I’ll share a trick that you can use to have a nice visualization like what you see in the above screenshot. Download the file and study more from

value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I’ll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi
